Rebecca Steorts taught English language arts classes at Princeton High School and Bluefield High School for 32 years.  She was a certified journalism teacher and her students won awards in journalism at Marshall University's High School Press and at Ball State University's summer journalism workshops.She became part of Steve Job's Apple computer revolution in 1985 and initiated desktop publishing in Mercer County.  She was the adviser of scholastic press at both high schools. She also wrote the curriculum for the Electives English program in Mercer Couny which included classes Semantics and Etymology, Writing Lab, Greek and Roman Mythology, Appalachian Literature, Creative Writing. She also coordinated school programs Hall of Fame (honoring distinguished alumni) and Laurel Leaves (student writing contest). She attended Advanced Placement teacher training at Concord University and her students excelled in the Advanced Placement Language classes.  She takes pride in the fact that many of her students used writing to CHANGE THE WORLD.
